> I would recommend using JUnit-addons' flexible Test Runner, then adding a listener that does the logging. Vladimir can confirm this as a good approach.

That's exactly what I would do.  And you don't have to develop your own 
listner: the DebugListener (printing out the name of the test about to 
be executed) is a standard component.

Just check out the code in the cvs tree and build it.

-Vladimir

PS: a short documentation is available as a wiki page.  Feel free to 
modify it according to your experience.

--
